publications: [{"title":"A Non-Euclidean Analysis of Definitions in “Elements of Geometry”(I)","subtitle":"InquiScitive","date":"February 15, 2021"},{"title":"Vicious Circle Principle: A Logical Antivenom in Mathematical Syringe","subtitle":"InquiScitive","date":"October 28, 2020"},{"title":"To the Realm of Fractals: A brief Dimensional Analysis","subtitle":"BEACON - MTMA Departmental Magazine, SXCCAL","date":"September 19, 2019"}]
projects: [{"title":"VISUALIZATION USING R: HDI & IHDI Analysis of Very High, High, Medium & Low Developed Countries","start_date":"Aug 2022","end_date":"Nov 2022","description":"The main goal of this project is to provide a visual representation of Human Development Index and Inequality-Adjusted HDI scenario to comparatively gauge a country’s spectrum of progress, or, on the other hand sole triggers of lagging behind, so as to initiate preventive measures to address the burning issues of today’s human civilization."},{"title":"A Voyage through the Realm of Dimensions: where Abstraction seems to meet Intuition","start_date":"Jun 2019","end_date":"Mar 2020","description":"My project was primarily aimed towards the derivation of Inductive dimensional value of n-Euclidean Space and hence showing the equivalence of Topological and Inductive dimensional concepts in the space underlying. The thesis mainly comprises of fields orienting Metric Space, Topology, Algebraic Geometry & Functional Analysis."},{}]
